results.title: A Century of fantastic cinema: an interactive history of science fiction and horror films (PC)
results.brief_description: Join Eddie Munster (Butch Patrick) as he leads you on a fascinating tour of horror and science fiction films, starting from the early silent days and leading into the 1980’s. You can look through the poster gallery and see some great pictures and eerie sound and voice tracks; check out celebrity profiles; see what’s on at the theatre and peruse the souvenirs, all from the comfort of your own home.

results.title: A Catalyst for development, K.T.T.C.
results.creator_credit: Kenneth McCready and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Kenya is vitally concerned with education. With the help of the Canadian International Development Agency, the government built the Kenya Technical Teachers’ College (K.T.T.C.), where it trains people to teach at every level of technical education. Once trained, these teachers go out to the numerous village polytechnics situated throughout Kenya and teach their skills. By teaching trade skills to villagers, local industries may be developed and technology will be introduced to the country.

results.title: A Cat's world
results.creator_credit: Robert Khodadad and Wall to Wall Television
results.brief_description: A Cat’s World is a fascinating foray into feline behaviour, examining how cats both perceive and react to the world around them by observing these mysterious creatures in domestic situations and in the wild beyond the home. Through the use of innovative camera techniques, the viewer can discover how cat senses function, and learn more about cat behaviour through the interpretation of visual cues.

results.title: A Case of eggs
results.creator_credit: Bernard Devlin, Daisy Bellefeuille, John Smith and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is a fast-moving spoof centred around Bruno, the moonlighter who despairs over his striking hens; Dean Goodspeak who hires Frances and Rita, of the Sisters of Detective Agency, to investigate the erratic behaviour of scientist Dr Morrow, a mysterious stranger; and David, the academic drop-out who is nursing a broken heart on his boat. An intriguing mystery story with an “all’s well that ends well” finish. Cast includes Peter Haworth, Micki Mansel, Jo Kirkpatrick and Bill Reiter. Packaged for Teaching English as a Second Language.

results.title: A Beethoven sonata
results.brief_description: One of Beethoven’s earliest works is finely played and recorded in this film. Dennis Brain (horn) and Dennis Matthews (piano) give a performance of the Sonata in F for horn and piano, Opus 17. Contrasts the horn as it was in Beethoven’s time with the improved and more complicated instrument of to-day. No other credits available.

results.title: A Career in bricklaying
results.creator_credit: Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description: This film emphasizes the positive aspects of work in bricklaying. As in most career films the less-favourable side of the work is omitted. Bricklayers are shown learning the trade, and the application of bricklaying skills is depicted in various constructions including ornamental brickwork, arches, and brickwork in high-rise buildings. Suitable for secondary school level.

results.title: A Calcutta Christmas
results.creator_credit: Maree Delofski, Denise Haslem, Film Australia and SBS Independent
results.brief_description: Tucked away in the middle of the noisy polluted ‘city of joy’, Calcutta, is Tollygunge Home - a haven of peace and quiet for 35 elderly Christian Anglo-Indian residents. During the British colonial rule, British men were encouraged to marry Indian women in order that their children would help further Britain’s imperial interest in India. Children of these marriages became known as Anglo-Indians (or in earlier years, Eurasians) and lived a fairly wealthy lifestyle during the British colonial years of the late 19th century. However as time went on, racism and discrimination began to seep in and Anglo-Indians then found themselves in limbo - neither Indian nor British. After India won independence in 1947, two-thirds of the Anglo-Indian community emigrated to other parts of the British Commonwealth such as Britain, Canada and Australia. Those left behind became dislocated from their families and their living conditions declined quite dramatically. Tollygunge Home is financed by the East India Charitable Fund and managed by a committee of volunteers for these Anglo-Indian residents and this documentary explores their thoughts, memories and lifestyle through interviews. Shows them preparing for Christmas day celebrations in the traditional British way and highlights the personal interactions which take place, not only the anger, jealousies and loneliness but also the friendships, the bonding and love which holds them together as a community. Narrated by Rachel Blake.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Maree Delofski, Denise Haslem, Film Australia and SBS Independent

results.title: A Bus for us
results.creator_credit: Rex Tasker, Len Chatwin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: After repeated attempts to obtain service from the public transportation authorities, these suburban Ottawa residents finally decided to do it themselves.

results.title: A Bug's life [DVD]
results.creator_credit: John Lasseter, Darla Anderson, Kevin Reher, Pixar Animation Studios and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: A Bug’s Life is a perfect example of how technology can be used to tell a good story. The computer generated animation from this Pixar film is amazing, but what makes it watchable are the gorgeous characters and enthralling story. When Flik endangers the future of the ant colony, Princess Atta sends him away to find help. A gang of grasshoppers- led by the menacing Hopper, will return by the end of the summer to accept the colony’s offering, which will take the colony the whole summer to collect. Flik runs into a group of circus performing insects who he mistakenly thinks are warriors. Will the colourful troupe and Flik be able to save the colony from Hopper’s wrath? Includes the voices of Kevin Spacey, Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Phyllis Diller, Denis Leary, Madeline Kahn and Roddy McDowall. The film also includes the Pixar animated short, “The Game”, which won the 1997 Academy Award for Best Animated Short.
